p: Alternatively to binder dissolution, the black mass coating from spent LCO batteries was successfully detached from the current collector by immersing the current collector in water at 55 Â°C in an ultrasonically agitated bath [ 103]. Yang et al. used the entire LFP electrode for the selective leaching process and reported that the coating detached from the Al sheet under agitation in the leaching reactor [ 77]. In both cases, the recovered active material was still trapped in the PVDF binder, which could weaken the diffusion of the ions and leaching agent during the dissolution process.
